doc.field: The Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
creation: 18th century; alteration: 1789; alteration: 1798; alteration: 1808; alteration: 1812-1813; alteration: circa 1915; alteration: early 20th century; alteration: 1952

Still in the Carter family to this day--West Oak--Forest Hill--Polly & Sally Carter Home, late 19th century--Later founded St Timothy's School, Catonville, MD--Served as Civil War hospital for Maryland Confederates--Mantel Details from William Pain's Carpenter and Joiners Repository, Practical House Carpenter & British Palladio

2 Story Brick, 5 Bay, Figural Spaces, Interesting Mantels, Bed Alcove, Bulkhead, Metal then Slate Hipped Roof, Flemish Bond, 3 Course American Bond, Penciling, Queens Closers, Rubbed Brick, Dumbwaiter, Pitsaw Marks, Summer Beams, Chamber Pot Shaft, 3 King Post Trusses, Corn Shuck Insulation in Floor, Self Closing Door Hinges, Center Passage not Through House, 2nd Floor Wine Storage, Porch, 2 Leaf Door, 6 Panel Doors, False Door, 6/6, 9/9, 12/12, Triple Hung Sash, Blinds, Fanlight, Barred Cellar Windows; Smokehouse, Slave Quarters, Threshing Barn, Delco House, Gardens, Ghost, 2 Rotunda Annex Capitals, Slave Cemetery in woods; Different Mantels and Cornices in each room; OriginalSmooth Plaster Wall Finish in Southwest Bedchamber; 17 Rooms, 12 Fireplaces, 2 Chimney Stacks
Martin Thacker, Builder 1798--Heston & Thomas Billups, Builders 1812--Howard Sill, Architect early 20th century--Milton Grigg, Architect 1952--Floyd Johnson, Architect 1950s
survey data: National Register of Historic Places--Virginia Landmarks Register--Studies in Vernacular Architecture--Virginia Road Traces

Martin Thacker, Builder 1798--Heston & Thomas Billups, Builders 1812--Howard Sill, Architect early 20th century--Milton Grigg, Architect 1952--Floyd Johnson, Architect 1950s
survey data: National Register of Historic Places--Virginia Landmarks Register--Studies in Vernacular Architecture--Virginia Road Traces
Frame Hall-Parlour House--Foundation dug--Brick House begun--Dated Brick--Frame Hall-Parlour House burned
